question.text: The high growth at the time of the exponential phase of the human population growth curve is due to:

options.text: high birth and low death rates
low birth and high death rates

solution.text:
Graphical representation of the population growth is referred to as population growth curve. There are four phases of growth curve-

Lag phase - initial phase of growth where population is adapting to the environment and resources are plenty.

Exponential phase - rapid increase in population size where birth rate is higher than death rate. Natality is higher and mortality is low as there is abundance of resources and reduced resistance from environment.

Transitional phase - Due to limited resources competition between organisms of population, the natality starts reducing and increasing mortality.

Plateau phase - the natality is nearly equal to the mortality and population growth becomes static.
